etymology.description: 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") + 又(又) (yòu, "hand") = taking the ear of prey (hunter's rite) -> "take"
etymology.interpretation: 取(取) (qǔ, "take") combines 耳(耳) (ěr, "ear") and 又(又) (yòu, "hand") to depict the act of taking the ear of a fallen prey, a ritual from the Rites of Zhou. This reflects the character's association with taking or acquiring something.

examples.chinese: 他从箱子里取出文件(他從箱子裏取出文件)。
examples.pinyin: Tā cóng xiāngzi lǐ qǔchū wénjiàn.
examples.english: He took out documents from the box.

examples.chinese: 请取钱包(請取錢包)，并支付费用(並支付費用)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng qǔ qiánbāo, bìng zhīfù fèiyòng.
examples.english: Please take the wallet and pay the fee.

examples.chinese: 他决定取胜于对手(他決定取勝於對手)。
examples.english: He decided to prevail over his opponent.
